### The Importance of Nail Health

Sarah's story highlights the importance of nail health and its connection to overall well-being. The condition of our nails can be a reflection of our body's internal state, and addressing any underlying issues can lead to significant improvements.

Nails are made of keratin, a protein that plays a crucial role in their strength and appearance. Factors like nutrient deficiencies, stress, and certain medical conditions can impact the quality of keratin production, leading to weak, brittle nails.

By addressing these underlying issues and providing the necessary nutrients and support, individuals can often see a transformation in the health and appearance of their nails. This not only improves the look of the nails but can also have a positive impact on one's self-confidence and overall quality of life.
